content: muzzle to lower part of face using embroidery floss or yarn and needle embroider an x shape in the middle of the muzzle and fill in the top part of the x with satin stitch or long stitches using sewing thread sew on buttons for eyes for ears the second round of single_crochet makes up the outer edge of the ear sew the bottom edge which includes the unworked sts of the first round to the top of the head slightly cupping the ear in the process for arms and legs add a small amount of stuffing to each and whipstitch to close forming a flat seam take the 2 legs and whipstitch them to the body seam to seam for jointed movable arms use button thread and two 2 hole buttons and refer to sewing instructions in diagram below otherwise sew arms to sides of body run button thread through the body arms and buttons for a poseable join variations i ve made the bears in rainbow colors simple and without embellishments ​ but you are welcome to adapt the pattern to make a unique bear of your own use a main color for the body and different colors for the arms and legs use a tweed or marl yarn with vintage buttons for a folk art style bear use a textured yarn for a fluffy bear or metallic yarn for an elegant bear or variegated yarn for a tie-dye look add a crocheted scarf or flower corsage tie a festive ribbon around the bear s neck add a bit of lace and pretty buttons for a fancy bear check out what s in your stash to help make this project truly your own--i can t wait to see them email me to get my occasional newsletter with updates and special offers donna childs crochets@gmail com show off your creations on the ravelry page https //www ravelry com/designers/donna-childs keep crocheting donna childs designer © 2020 all rights reserved this pattern or any portion thereof may not be reproduced or used in any manner whatsoever without the express written permission of the designer
